Piles

what is piles?

The term pile refers to a collection of swollen and inflamed tissue in the anal area. They may be internal or external and can come in a range of sizes. Discomfort is a common symptom, especially during bowel movements or when sitting.

Other symptoms include itching and bleeding. An internal pile is usually found between 2 and 4 centimeters (cm) above the opening of the anus, and it is the most commonly found type. An external pile is located outside the anus.

Types of piles?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” gutter_width__hover_enabled=”on|desktop”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Piles” image=”https://vedascure.in/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/piles_.png” _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” header_font=”Merriweather||||||||” header_font_size=”40px” body_font=”ABeeZee||||||||” body_font_size=”16px” background_enable_color=”off” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_start=”#e8e8e8″ background_color_gradient_end=”rgba(255,255,255,0.8)” custom_padding=”|||10px||” box_shadow_style_image=”preset3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • During pregnancy, this is common.
  • an itchy anus
  • External or internal, they can be both.
  • Symptoms such as bleeding after passing stool and bloody stools can appear.
  • External hemorrhoids can sometimes develop when blood clots around the anus.
  • It usually cures by itself even before any symptoms appear.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Fissure” image=”https://vedascure.in/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/fisure.png” _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” header_font=”Merriweather||||||||” header_font_size=”40px” body_font=”ABeeZee||||||||” body_font_size=”16px” background_enable_color=”off” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_start=”#e8e8e8″ background_color_gradient_end=”rgba(255,255,255,0.8)” custom_padding=”|||10px||” box_shadow_style_image=”preset3″ locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Occasionally occurs when a person stretches and presses too much while defecating.
  • Infected ones may ooze pus or blood.
  • The symptoms may occur from diarrhea, constipation, or heavy exercise.
  • Over 50s are mostly affected by them.
  • Acute and chronic forms of these diseases are possible.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Fistula” image=”https://vedascure.in/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/fistula.png” _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” header_font=”Merriweather||||||||” header_font_size=”40px” body_font=”ABeeZee||||||||” body_font_size=”16px” background_enable_color=”off” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_start=”#e8e8e8″ background_color_gradient_end=”rgba(255,255,255,0.8)” custom_padding=”|||10px||” box_shadow_style_image=”preset3″ locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • A number of factors can cause them, such as radiation, cancer, warts, trauma, and Crohn’s disease.
  • Those who are obese and spend long hours sitting may also suffer from these problems.
  • They appear as a red, swollen, painful, and pus-oozing open wound.
  • Antibiotics can be used to treat them.
  • Painful bowel movements

    [/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#f9f9f9″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.11.2″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”ABeeZee||||||||” header_font=”Merriweather|800||on|||||” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”53px” header_text_shadow_style=”preset2″ header_text_shadow_horizontal_length=”0em” header_text_shadow_vertical_length=”0.11em” header_text_shadow_blur_strength=”0.22em” header_text_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.2)” locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”]

    Why Vedas Cure Piles treatment is right for you?

    Vedas Cure piles treatment is one of the best treatments for piles in India. This treatment has already treated thousands of patients till now. Vedas Cure piles medicine is made up of herbal composition and is 100% natural. Piles medicines are Piles Care, Saptvinshati Guggulu, and Jatyadi Tail.
    Piles Care includes herbs like Belgiri, Giloy, Mulethi, Amla, etc. These herbs helps to treat constipation problems which is the main reason for piles. Saptvinshati Guggulu helps in the quick healing of wounds and gives relief in pain. Jataydi oil aids in purifying the blood, disinfecting the wounds, and initiating the healing process in the tissues.

    Personalized Everything

    The basic diet for piles

    Fiber-rich foods can prevent and treat piles, as they increase the bulk of the stool and promote proper bowel movements.

    These foods include:

    • Green leafy vegetables: These foods are rich in antioxidants and fiber, which are good for digestion and stomach health. Examples of vegetables you can include in your diet are spinach, fenugreek, celery, mustard greens, radish greens, etc.
    • Whole grains: Eat whole grains such as brown rice, oatmeal, bran cereal, whole wheat flour, and multigrain bread for a healthy weight.
      Fresh fruits are an excellent source of fiber, vitamins, and minerals, especially if eaten along with their skin.

excerpt.rendered: Piles what is piles? The term pile refers to a collection of swollen and inflamed tissue in the anal area. They may be internal or external and can come in a range of sizes. Discomfort is a common symptom, especially during bowel movements or when sitting. Other symptoms include itching and bleeding. An internal pile […]
